intro: Borreria cristata, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its distinctive zigzagging stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. Borreria cristata is often used in ornamental gardening due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
